item.title: L'énergie en France
item.description: Aujourd’hui en France, la consommation d’énergie ne cesse d’augmenter et le stock d’énergies fossiles de diminuer. A votre avis quelle place va jouer le nucléaire en Europe dans la production d’énergie par rapport aux autres énergies renouvelables ?

item.title: Applying to Cambridge?
item.description: I often get asked about where I go to university and when I reply, this usually elicits faces of surprise, excitement, or in some cases shock. It’s a curious topic for many, and I can’t blame them for it! I would’ve equally wanted to know more about applying in my younger days too.

item.title: Modelling of diseases
item.description: I was bored and in a world where doom and gloom were around me, so I decided to model that. A lot of the inspiration for this came from a video I watched by 3Blue1Brown about modelling infectious diseases, like COVID-19. This experiment was a fun trial of CSS grid, which at the time was completely new to me.

item.title: Timeout VC
item.description: For my work on Timeout, I was given an award by my University, signed by the Pro-Vice Chancellor for Education. Here’s another news post by the Engineering Department. I’ve written two blog posts on Timeout, one on its historical origins and another on its technical aspects. I recently wrote a WSGI frontend to interact with the BigBlueButton API called LightBlueTent.

item.title: Assorted games
item.description: List of games A curated list of the games that made the cut (looking back at my 14-year-old self was tough!) is shown here: Catch! – Can you catch the shapes in time? Grinch Invaders – A shooter game inspired by space invaders Dabble – Like scrabble but now you have to dodge!

item.title: About me
item.description: I’m Matias - an engineering student at Cambridge University, currently in my second year and set to graduate with a Master’s in Engineering. Though I’m “officially” an engineering ugrad, my interests are varied ranging from software development and deployment, Linux sysadmining, embedded systems, cooking and linguistics. What am I studying? I’m an undergraduate student in the Engineering Department at the University of Cambridge.
